Description: Neck and shoulder sherd (mended from four fragments) of East Greek (South Ionian) pottery oinochoe; ridge on lower part of neck; fine orange clay with much silver mica; cream slip, exterior: traces of decorative band on mid-neck and verticals at either side of lost) handle; on shoulder, tongue pattern (some red) flanking large pendant lotus blossom lined with dots; verticals to either side and perhaps upright lotuses flanking handle; glazed zone below with added red band lined in white. Inscription cut on shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 1b)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 641, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.048)
